text.0: With a loud voice glorify God, in the congregation of the many proclaim His majesty.
text.1: In the multitude of the upright glorify His name, and with the faithful recount His greatness.
text.2: Bind your souls to the good ones, and to the pure ones to glorify the Most High.
text.3: Form an assembly to proclaim His salvation, and be not lax in making known His might and His majesty to all simple folk.
text.4: For to make known the glory of the LORD is Wisdom given.
text.5: And for recounting His many deeds She was revealed to men.
text.6: To make known to the simple folk His might, and to explain to senseless folk His greatness.
text.7: Those far from Her gates, those who stray from Her portals.
text.8: For the Most High is the Lord of Jacob, and His majesty is over all His works.
text.9: And a man who glorifies the Most High, He accepts as one who brings a meal-offering.
text.10: As one who offers he-goats and bullocks; as one who fattens the altar with many burnt offerings; as with a sweet-smelling fragrance from the hand of the righteous.
text.11: From the gates of the righteous Her voice is heard, and from the assembly of the pious Her song.
text.12: When they eat with satiety She is cited, and when they drink in a community together.
text.13: Their meditation is on the Law of the Most High, their words on making known His might.
text.14: How far from the wicked is Her word, from all haughty men to know Her.
text.15: Behold the eyes of the LORD are compassionate over the good ones.
text.16: And upon those who glorify Him He increases His mercy; from an evil time will He deliver their soul.
text.17: Bless the LORD, who redeems the humble from the hand of adversaries, and He delivers the perfect from the power of the wicked.
text.18: Who establishes a horn out of Jacob, and a judge of peoples out of Israel.
text.19: He who desires his habitation in Zion, choose Jerusalem forever.
